page.title: 11SOUTH CREAKE, LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The fact this is a Domesday village means that this BBC project has particular appeal. The history society researches village origins. Bloodgate Hill, on Bluestone Farm, is an ancient monument. The little that remains is appreciated best from aerial photographs. The village existed in Saxon times, and was assessed for Danegeld in AD886. The mediaeval Church of St Mary, was rebuilt in its present form by the Priory of Castle Acre. The sites of two of the four Conquest manors are known. One has an occupied 16 C. manor house. The other site is revealed by the outline of its foundation, in a meadow between Church and School. Authorities differ on the origin of the name. One considers that Creake derives from River, uses the word for an escarpment.
